onto.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object
onto.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She watched him walk onto the platform.
Don’t jump onto  (=into) the bus while it’s moving.
Pour the syrup on to the egg mixture.
The car rolled over onto its side.
Let’s get back onto the highway.
onto.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to say that a room, door, or window faces towards something or allows movement into another place
onto.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The dining room looks out onto a pretty garden.
a gate leading on to a broad track
